content.description: The following question refers to the topic of the rise of global markets in the 1700s.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why the trade rivalry between European states resulted in Britain becoming the dominant power by the end of the 1700s?

choices.label: Britain’s access to resources and improvements in finance and industry allowed its economy to grow more rapidly than other countries.
Britain’s constitutional reforms, such as the Act of Union with Scotland, improved the stability of its government relative to the governments of other European powers.
Britain’s policy of relative religious toleration made British colonies an attractive destination for migrants from continental Europe.
Britain’s sponsorship of natural scientists such as Isaac Newton through the Royal Society gave Britain a technological advantage over its rivals.

content.answer: Britain’s access to resources and improvements in finance and industry allowed its economy to grow more rapidly than other countries.
